title: What is the difference between genuine magnetism and charlatanism?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discourses on the history of magnetism, illustrating how some people who were not true magnetizers were falsely attributed with this title. The author points out that the only thing that Cagliostro, the infamous character, invented was his repertoire of criminal activities rather than a discovery of the mysteries of magnetism. The latter part of the text discusses the types of people that practice magnetism and graphology or handwriting analysis, with the author distinguishing between true magnetizers and charlatans. The author then mentions the death of a famous medium, Daniel Dunglas Home, and how the practice of magnetism, or hypnotism as some people call it, has now been accepted as a scientific field of study.
content: Egalement le truc de la suspension aérienne, pièce de mécanique habilement construite par Robcrt-IIoudin et qui maintient horizontalement en l’air, sans support apparent, une femme qui fait semblant de dormir, le coude simplement appuyé sur l’extrémité d’une canne. Tout le monde a vu cet ingénieux mécanisme qu’on intitule aussi « La femme fukir » et dont, moyennant cent francs, chez Voisin, à Paris, on peut se procurer un exemplaire. Les miracles, parle temps qui court, se vendent bon marché. Mais loin d’infirmer le magnétisme, ces trucs eux-mêmes, que les simples d’esprit prennent au sérieux, fournissent l’irrécusable témoignage de son existence. Les inventions de l’homme ne sont ni des parcelles de son cerveau, ni des portions de son âme. Le siège de son intelligence est comme un creuset où les souvenirs et les observations se réunissent, se condensent et se com- . ; binent pour élaborer des choses nouvelles composées de l’alliance intime des vérités primordiales. Du néant, l’homme ne peut rien faire jaillir; il ne peut imaginer ce qui serait contraire à ses connaissances et à la nature. Si l'homme n’avait découvert ou cru reconnaître qu’on peut quelquefois voir comme intérieurement et sans le secours des yeux, il n’aurait pu l’inventer.
last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the qualities of a good subject for magnetic and hypnotic experiments is crucial in order to obtain reliable results. While there are many tricks and illusions out there, such as the suspension device created by Robert-Houdin, these do not invalidate the existence of true magnetic phenomena. It is important to distinguish between real and fake magnetism and to be wary of subjects who are not fully susceptible to the experience. It is also essential to have an experienced operator to ensure the safety and well-being of the subjects involved. With proper understanding and careful experimentation, the study of magnetism and hypnotism can lead to fascinating discoveries.
